section.heading: Definitions.
section.text: For purposes of this subchapter, the term:

para.text: “Complaint examiner” means the person designated by the Executive Director to determine the merits of a complaint.
“Executive Director” means the head of the Office of Police Complaints.
“Gender identity or expression” shall have the same meaning as provided in § 2-1401.02(12A).
“Office” means the Office of Police Complaints.

annotations.annotation: D.C. Law 15-194, in pars. (1), (3), and (4), substituted “Police Complaints” for “Citizen Complaint Review”.

Applicability of D.C. Law 24-345: § 301 of D.C. Law 24-345 provided that the change made to this section by § 105(c) of D.C. Law 24-345 is subject to the inclusion of the law’s fiscal effect in an approved budget and financial plan. Therefore that amendment has not been implemented.
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2(a) of Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Technical Emergency Amendment Act of 2023 (D.C. Act 25-115, May 24, 2023, 70 DCR 7944).

For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2(a) of Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Technical Congressional Review Emergency Amendment Act of 2023 (D.C. Act 25-197, July 27, 2023, 70 DCR 10742).
For temporary (225 days) amendment of this section, see § 2(a) of Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Technical Temporary Amendment Act of 2023 (D.C. Law 25-41, Aug. 17, 2023, 70 DCR 9042).

Section 7097 of D.C. Law 25-50 amended section 301(a)(1) of D.C. Law 24-345 retaining the applicability provision impacting this section. Therefore the amendment of this section by section 105(c) of Law 24-345 still has not been implemented.
For temporary (90 days) amendment of this section, see § 2(a) of Comprehensive Policing and Justice Reform Technical Emergency Amendment Act of 2024 (D.C. Act 25-426, Mar. 25, 2024, 71 DCR 3522).
Section 4 of D.C. Act 25-426 provided that the amendments made to this section by section 2(a) of D.C.Act 25-426 shall expire on the applicability date of section 105 of D.C. Law 24-345.
